author: Legonat
title: First to review!
review:
• I found this at a Learning express store in NC and just had to get one.

            Pros

            Rare minifig


            Cons

            Seems glossy and unattractive,

            Did they have to be in grab bags?

   
            Overall a 4/5

author: MisterGeolix814
title: saving lives, and saving the lego minifigure demand.
review:
i got this on 9-8-10. unfortunately, they were $2.99each and i could only get 2. they were lifeguard, and judoka. anyway...

PROS:

  • VERY light hair
  • new piece
  • nice legs

CONS:

  • overpriced
  • limit 2 per customer

i think this minifigure is a good one.

author: alva
title: A Pamela Anderson Minifig
review:
The first thing that crossed my mind when I looked at this minifig is how she looks like Pamela Anderson on Baywatch series. She even bring her own buoy (is that the correct term for this item?), just like Pamela did.

Nothing special about this minifig, except that she wears a one piece red swimsuit. Quite unique. I think the other minifigs that ever came close is the Paradisa figs. But this fig still better than them.

The only minor problem for this minifig is the printing. This minifig is suppose to be a minifig that wearing a one-piece swimsuit, right? But if you bend the legs to the back a bit, you can see that the printing doesn't go all the way inside.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Collectable Minifigures (Series 2) - Life Guard Review
review:
This figure is also one of my favourite figures of series 2. I like the markings we get on the swimsuit and I also like the face on this figure and as usual in the Collectable Minifigures theme we get a black stand. The only thing I have to complain about the life guard is that the legs don't have any printings on the back.

All in all it's a great set to get and I would HIGHLY recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure.

author: CharlieTheFunEngine
title: TinyTurbosCityAndToyStory Reviews Episode 19: Life Guard
review:
The Life Guard was my fourth Collectable Minifigure from Series 2 and my first female minifigure but she's slightly underwhelming. From feeling the packet I thought she was the Spartan - huge disappointment when I opened it up.

Building Experience:

It's a minifigure, can't expect too much.

Parts:

Like all of the Collectable Minifigures the face is brand new. The hair is wonderful and the black stand is quite useful. The problem I have is the same as the Surfer - the leg printing just doesn't go back far enough.

Playability:

Not fantastic, but then none of these minifigures are. They're really more for display purposes.

Value for Money:

I paid AUD$3 for this Minifigure and it was 20% off. A bit of a letdown to find the Life Guard in the pack but my City was seriously lacking female residents anyway.

Overall:

Great to finally have a female minifigure but not exactly what I was hoping to find in the pack. Hours of fun, maybe.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Some People Stand in the Shadows...
review:
Set #8684 Life Guard: This particular Minifigure was on my short list of must own figures, in spite of many others coming out this particular one hasn't been seen again so I was thrilled to find it at very long last, last year.

The Life Guard is dressed in a red one piece swimsuit that is obviously inspired by one of the hottest prime time shows of the 90's. Her print is single-sided and features the initials G.T. The life preserver piece was introduced with her and it looks great, we've only seen it twice in total as of this date from what I've seen, I don't believe it's been included in any other sets. The same can not be said of her blonde hair piece with the long ponytail at the end, it's been used numerous times by now, and it is a fairly decent hair piece. Her simple facial expression is also quite nice for a CMF with visible lipstick.

Overall the Life Guard, in my opinion, was one of the best Minifigures from Series 2, and while others definitely outshone her in certain areas she is still a must own figure. I am very pleased to have been able to add her to my collection and I wholeheartedly recommend her.

author: sideswinger
title: An okay figure!
review:
So the eighth figure in the LEGO Minifigures Series 2 is the Lifeguard, and she's a figure I used to despise. But what do I think now? Well let's get a closer look.

On top we have that big pony tail piece, which isn't anything too special. It is caste in that spring yellow, which wasn't new or anything, and it isn't a rare color or anything either. I don't mind that too much though.

Next we have her face which to me, looks a bit odd. That smirk just looks a little awkward, and her raised eyebrows just look weird too. I don't know, just the hole thing looks off to me. No alternate face either, which is common for 2010.

Then we have her torso, which is pretty cool, I guess. I like those curve lines, as well as the little life saver logo on her bottom corner, and if you look closely you can see the letters "G.T" in the top left corner of her shirt. I don't know if that's a reference or something, but nonetheless. She also has yellow flesh printed on there, and if you look at some other online images, you'll see that it looks a little odd. This is because light colors printed on darker ones don't mix well, which we see here. It's a common mistake in LEGO, but oh well. No back torso printing either.

Then we have her legs, which do have a bit of printing on them, with that red swimsuit design. Nothing too exciting, but at least LEGO put in the effort to print them at all.

And finally, we have her accessory, which is pretty cool. It is a red flotation board which is very great and also very fitting. It was new for the figure as well, which is just awesome. Overall, it's a nice piece.

And the figure as a whole is beginning to grow on me. However, with that being said, she still isn't one of my favorites. She's in the lower middle tier for me, and might still be one of my leas favorites from Series 2. On the bright side, she's a lot better than the awful Series 12 Life Guard. But don't even get me started on him. And I think that wraps up this review! So check out my other Series 1 and 2 reviews, and thanks for reading!
